messages.subject: Re: Harry Potter fans
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 12/31/2001 4:36:16 AM Eastern Standard Time, ... For some reason this reminds me of a short-lived Girl Scout marketing campaign: The girl
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 12/31/2001 4:36:16 AM Eastern Standard Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:

> Do you suppose that's a good thing, or a bad thing? <g>
>
> Pam
>
> ----------
> From: "Jorgen & Ann" <stargate@...>
> To: <AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com>
> Subject: [AlwaysLearning] For Harry Potter fans
> Date: Sun, Dec 30, 2001, 9:00 AM
>
>
> Asked about their relationship. Rowling sighed and said
> "he leaves me numb."
>
>

For some reason this reminds me of a short-lived Girl Scout marketing
campaign: The girl comes first in Girl Scouting.

They sent out pencils, tee shirts, etc. with this slogan on it. Then people
began to laugh across the nation. Then they took it away. I thought it was
GREAT marketing, myself.

Kathryn


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
